overview_summary: All four profiled neighbors have not publicly stated a position on local development, leaving their stances unknown. Their community influence appears limited, with only one neighbor (a local news contributor) exhibiting a moderate public profile.

neighbors.name: Leslie Wade Armentrout & Shelly Dawn Martin
neighbors.claims: Leslie and Shelly Armentrout are Hardy County landowners with no record of holding public office or voicing opinions in local development debates ([www.whsv.com](https://www.whsv.com/2023/05/11/hardy-county-residents-upset-over-proposed-log-fumigation-facility/#:~:text=%E2%80%9CWe%E2%80%99re%20scared%20to%20death%2C%20we%E2%80%99re,the%20proposed%20fumigation%20plant%20site)) ([www.whsv.com](https://www.whsv.com/2023/05/11/hardy-county-residents-upset-over-proposed-log-fumigation-facility/#:~:text=Another%20issue%20that%20many%20have,advertisement%20in%20the%20Moorefield%20Examiner)). The Armentrout surname is historically rooted in Hardy County, though neither appears in recent civic meetings or news reports ([www.wvgw.net](https://www.wvgw.net/hardy/armentr.htm#:~:text=,copies%20of%20proofs%20have%20also)).

approach_recommendations.engage: Maintain a neighborly approach and share information transparently, listening to any concerns they may raise.

neighbors.name: Steven C. Pendleton
neighbors.claims: Steven C. Pendleton (known as Steve Pendleton) is a local resident who has written news articles on Hardy County school and government matters ([hardylive.com](https://hardylive.com/2025/01/13/board-of-education-readies-buses-for-use/#:~:text=By%20Steve%20Pendleton)). He has not been identified taking a public stand for or against area development projects in available records ([hardylive.com](https://hardylive.com/2025/09/16/public-hearing-reveals-divide-on-agriculture-language-in-draft-comprehensive-plan/#:~:text=Several%20residents%20noted%20concerns%20about,in%20the%20Old%20Fields%20area)).

approach_recommendations.engage: Provide clear, factual information through respectful communication, as he is informed and connected via local media.

neighbors.name: Eric A. Tasker
neighbors.claims: Eric A. Tasker is listed as a property owner in Hardy County but has no presence in local news archives or public meeting records ([hardylive.com](https://hardylive.com/2025/09/16/public-hearing-reveals-divide-on-agriculture-language-in-draft-comprehensive-plan/#:~:text=Several%20residents%20noted%20concerns%20about,in%20the%20Old%20Fields%20area)). There are no indications of civic roles or statements from Tasker regarding development or community issues in the county ([hardylive.com](https://hardylive.com/2025/09/16/public-hearing-reveals-divide-on-agriculture-language-in-draft-comprehensive-plan/#:~:text=Several%20residents%20noted%20concerns%20about,in%20the%20Old%20Fields%20area)).

approach_recommendations.engage: Approach one-on-one in a polite, informal manner to build trust and understand any concerns or questions.

neighbors.name: Gerald Johnson
neighbors.claims: Gerald Johnson owns property in Hardy County but does not appear in available public records for community leadership or activism ([hardylive.com](https://hardylive.com/2025/09/16/public-hearing-reveals-divide-on-agriculture-language-in-draft-comprehensive-plan/#:~:text=Several%20residents%20noted%20concerns%20about,in%20the%20Old%20Fields%20area)). No news reports or official minutes suggest any public comments or positions from Johnson on local projects ([hardylive.com](https://hardylive.com/2025/09/16/public-hearing-reveals-divide-on-agriculture-language-in-draft-comprehensive-plan/#:~:text=Several%20residents%20noted%20concerns%20about,in%20the%20Old%20Fields%20area)).

approach_recommendations.engage: Engage through friendly, personal outreach and provide information mindful of his privacy, inviting him to share any feedback.
